ws.rocket.config.bean

Class BeanValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ws.rocket.config.bean.BeanValidator

  • public final class BeanValidator
extends Object
    Provides checks to be performed on a target type, which is expected to be bean. When a check fails, a ModelException will be raised together with message describing the failed check.
    Author:
    Martti Tamm
    See Also:
    ModelException

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BeanValidator(BeanType<?> beanType)
      Creates a new instance of validator for given bean type.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BeanType<?> getBeanType()
      Provides the current bean type.
      void requireEmptyConstructor()
      Checks that the underlying type has a default constructor.
      void requireProperty(String property, Class<?> collectionType, Class<?> arrayCompType)
      Checks that the underlying type has at least one setter method for given property that accepts a parameter that is either of collectionType or an array of arrayCompType.
      void requirePropertyValueConstructor(String property, int constrParamCount)
      Checks that the underlying type has a writable property with a type that has a constructor with exactly constrParamCount parameters.
      void requireSetterMethod(String property)
      Checks that the underlying type has at least one setter method for given property.
      static void validateMap(Class<?> collectionType, Class<?> mainValueType, String propertyName)
      This method does not check bean, but the parameters, instead: the collection type must be java.util.Map.class and the main value type must be String.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Creates a new instance of validator for given bean type.

    • Method Detail

      • getBeanType

        public BeanType<?> getBeanType()
        Provides the current bean type.
        Returns:
        The bean type.

      • requireEmptyConstructor

        public void requireEmptyConstructor()
        Checks that the underlying type has a default constructor.

      • requireSetterMethod

        public void requireSetterMethod(String property)
        Checks that the underlying type has at least one setter method for given property.
        Parameters:
        property - The bean property name to check (required).

      • requireProperty

        public void requireProperty(String property,
                   Class<?> collectionType,
                   Class<?> arrayCompType)
        Checks that the underlying type has at least one setter method for given property that accepts a parameter that is either of collectionType or an array of arrayCompType.
        Parameters:
        property - The bean property name to check (required).
        collectionType - The collection type to check (required).
        arrayCompType - The array component type to check (required).

      • requirePropertyValueConstructor

        public void requirePropertyValueConstructor(String property,
                                   int constrParamCount)
        Checks that the underlying type has a writable property with a type that has a constructor with exactly constrParamCount parameters.
        Parameters:
        property - The bean property name to check (required).
        constrParamCount - The amount of parameters required for the class constructor.

      • validateMap

        public static void validateMap(Class<?> collectionType,
               Class<?> mainValueType,
               String propertyName)
        This method does not check bean, but the parameters, instead: the collection type must be java.util.Map.class and the main value type must be String. This check is mostly used by bean writers that accept only a map collection, and perform some sort of bean mapping with the map keys.
        Parameters:
        collectionType - The collection type to check (required).
        mainValueType - The main collection value type to check (required).
        propertyName - A free-form string describing the property names this check applies to. Used in error message.
